memory_items.title: Clean Object with Appropriate Tool
memory_items.description: Use the correct object and receptacle to clean an item.
memory_items.content: To clean an object, use the appropriate cleaning tool (like soapbar or sink) in the correct receptacle. Ensure the object is in the same location as the cleaning tool before attempting to clean it.

memory_items.title: Verify Object in Inventory
memory_items.description: Confirm the object is in the inventory before attempting to move it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to move an object to a receptacle, ensure the object is in the inventory. If it is not, check the current location and retrieve it.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions
memory_items.description: Use the check valid actions command to understand available interactions.
memory_items.content: Before executing an action, use 'check valid actions' to confirm the available commands and ensure the action is feasible in the current context.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeating Failed Actions
memory_items.description: Stop repeating actions that have already failed without understanding the reason.
memory_items.content: If an action does not produce the desired outcome, investigate the cause instead of repeating the same action. This avoids wasting time and resources on ineffective steps.

memory_items.title: Use Correct Syntax for Actions
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct syntax is used for object and receptacle interactions.
memory_items.content: Actions involving objects and receptacles require the correct syntax, such as 'clean [object] with [receptacle]'. Incorrect formatting or object names can lead to failure.

memory_items.title: Identify Correct Object Before Cooling
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct object (mug) is identified and located before attempting to cool it.
memory_items.content: Before cooling an object, verify its identity and location. Use examine commands to confirm the object is a mug and locate it in the environment.

memory_items.title: Cool Object Using Appropriate Method
memory_items.description: Cool the object using the correct method, such as placing it in a fridge or freezer.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, place it in a fridge or freezer. Ensure the fridge is open and accessible before attempting to cool the object.

memory_items.title: Check Object Availability in Target Container
memory_items.description: Verify the target container (coffeemachine) is accessible and has space for the cooled object.
memory_items.content: Before placing the cooled object in the coffeemachine, confirm that the coffeemachine is accessible and has available space to accommodate the object.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation Without Purpose
memory_items.description: Avoid unnecessary repeated navigation between locations without a clear objective.
memory_items.content: Minimize redundant movements between locations. Focus on a clear path to achieve the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Held Objects
memory_items.description: Track the objects you are carrying using the inventory command to prevent confusion.
memory_items.content: Use the inventory command to keep track of objects you are holding. This helps avoid errors when moving or placing objects.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Take
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is present in the current location before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before taking an object, check the current location's contents to confirm the object exists. This avoids unnecessary actions and wasted steps.

memory_items.title: Open Target Receptacle Before Placing Object
memory_items.description: Always open the target drawer or receptacle before attempting to place an object inside.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object into a drawer, make sure the drawer is open. This is a critical step to ensure the object can be placed successfully.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Held Objects
memory_items.description: Regularly check the inventory to confirm which objects are being carried.
memory_items.content: After taking an object, verify its presence in the inventory to avoid confusion and ensure the correct object is being moved.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repeating the same action without checking for progress or success.
memory_items.content: If an action does not yield the expected result, reassess the situation and adjust the strategy. Repeating the same action without feedback can lead to inefficiency.

memory_items.title: Complete Task with Final Placement
memory_items.description: Ensure both objects are successfully placed in the target drawer before declaring the task complete.
memory_items.content: After placing the first object, confirm the second object is also placed in the drawer. Only then should the task be marked as completed.

memory_items.description: Identify and retrieve objects directly from their location without unnecessary steps.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Placement
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is successfully placed in the target location after moving it.
memory_items.content: After attempting to move an object to the target location, confirm that the action was successful. If the object does not appear in the target location, reattempt the move or check for any possible errors in the command.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Carried Objects
memory_items.description: Check inventory to confirm which objects are currently being carried.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to move an object, verify its presence in the inventory to ensure it is being carried. This helps prevent errors when moving objects between locations.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Unnecessary Actions
memory_items.description: Minimize repeated actions that do not contribute to the task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly navigating to the same location or performing the same action without a clear purpose. This reduces the risk of failure and speeds up task completion.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions for Clarity
memory_items.description: Use the 'check valid actions' command to understand available options and ensure correct syntax.
memory_items.content: Before performing an action, use 'check valid actions' to confirm the correct command syntax and available options. This helps prevent errors and ensures the action is executed properly.

memory_items.title: Use Light Source Correctly
memory_items.description: Ensure the light source is active before examining an object.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to examine an object with a light source, confirm that the light source is functioning. If the light source does not activate, consider other ways to illuminate the object or verify if the light source is properly positioned.

memory_items.title: Examine Object in Light
memory_items.description: Examine the object while it is under the light source.
memory_items.content: To examine an object with a light source, ensure the object is placed under the light and then use the examine command while the light is active. This ensures the object is properly illuminated for examination.

memory_items.title: Check Object Placement
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is in the correct location relative to the light source.
memory_items.content: Verify that the object is within the light's range and positioned correctly to be examined under the light. If the object is not in the right location, move it closer or adjust its placement.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repeatedly using the same action without results.
memory_items.content: If an action does not yield results, consider alternative approaches or check if the object or light source is in the correct state. Repeating the same action without adjustment is inefficient and may lead to failure.

memory_items.title: Understand Task Requirements
memory_items.description: Ensure the task is understood correctly.
memory_items.content: Clarify the task requirements, especially for complex interactions like examining an object with a light source. Understanding the exact steps needed can prevent unnecessary actions and improve task success.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Search
memory_items.description: Search for objects in likely locations rather than randomly navigating.
memory_items.content: Instead of randomly moving between locations, focus on areas where objects are commonly found, such as shelves, drawers, or sidetables. This reduces the time spent searching and increases the chances of finding the required objects efficiently.

memory_items.title: Object Pickup and Placement
memory_items.description: Pick up objects and place them in the correct location without unnecessary movements.
memory_items.content: Once an object is found, pick it up immediately and proceed directly to the target location. Avoid backtracking or revisiting locations unnecessarily, which wastes time and may lead to confusion.

memory_items.title: Inventory Management
memory_items.description: Keep track of carried objects to avoid confusion when placing multiple items.
memory_items.content: Maintain awareness of what objects are currently being carried. This helps in managing the task of placing two objects without mixing up or losing track of items.

memory_items.title: Target Location Verification
memory_items.description: Ensure the target location is accessible and clear before attempting to place objects.
memory_items.content: Before placing objects in a receptacle, verify that the location is accessible and that there is space available. This avoids failed attempts due to incorrect assumptions about the target location.

memory_items.title: Avoiding Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Minimize repeated actions that do not contribute to the task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid repetitive navigation or checking of locations that have already been verified. This helps in maintaining focus on the task and reduces the risk of getting stuck in a loop.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Identify and retrieve objects directly from their locations without unnecessary actions.
memory_items.content: When searching for objects, directly interact with their locations to pick them up. Avoid redundant actions like examining or moving objects that are not needed.

memory_items.title: Proper Container Handling
memory_items.description: Open containers before placing objects inside them.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to place an object in a drawer or receptacle, ensure it is open. This avoids failed attempts due to closed containers.

memory_items.title: Sequential Object Handling
memory_items.description: Pick up one object, place it, then proceed to the next object.
memory_items.content: Handle objects sequentially to avoid confusion. Pick up one object, place it in the target location, and then move to the next object to prevent carrying multiple items at once.

memory_items.title: Avoiding Redundant Navigation
memory_items.description: Minimize unnecessary navigation to reduce task complexity.
memory_items.content: Focus on the necessary locations for object retrieval and placement. Avoid repeatedly moving between locations without a clear purpose to save time and prevent errors.

memory_items.title: Valid Action Utilization
memory_items.description: Use valid actions to ensure successful object movement.
memory_items.content: Always check valid actions before attempting to move an object. This helps avoid invalid moves and ensures the correct syntax is used for successful placement.

memory_items.description: Directly navigate to likely locations for the target object before searching.
memory_items.content: Start by checking common locations like shelves, countertops, and drawers where objects are typically found. Avoid unnecessary back-and-forth movements by focusing on relevant areas.

memory_items.title: Quick Item Retrieval
memory_items.description: Retrieve the target object directly from its location without unnecessary delays.
memory_items.content: Once the target object is located, take it immediately to minimize steps and avoid confusion. Use the 'take' command with the correct object and location.

memory_items.title: Direct Placement Strategy
memory_items.description: Move the object to the target receptacle as soon as it is retrieved.
memory_items.content: After picking up the object, navigate directly to the target receptacle and use the 'move' command to place the object there. This reduces the number of steps and ensures efficient task completion.

memory_items.title: Avoiding Redundant Actions

memory_items.content: Do not repeatedly attempt to go to non-existent or irrelevant locations. Focus on locations where the object is likely to be found based on the environment's structure.

memory_items.title: Utilize Inventory Check
memory_items.description: Verify the inventory to ensure the object is carried before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object to a receptacle, confirm that it is in the inventory. This prevents errors and ensures the task is completed smoothly.

memory_items.title: Identify Mug Location Before Cooling
memory_items.description: Locate the mug before attempting to cool it.
memory_items.content: Before cooling an object, first search for the target object in visible locations like countertops, cabinets, or other accessible areas. This ensures the object is available for the subsequent cooling action.

memory_items.title: Use Fridge for Cooling
memory_items.description: Cool an object using a fridge.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, use the 'cool [object] with [receptacle]' command with a fridge as the receptacle. This is the correct method to achieve the cooling effect in the environment.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Receptacle
memory_items.description: Place the cooled object into the designated receptacle.
memory_items.content: After cooling the object, move it to the target receptacle using the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command. Ensure the receptacle is accessible and properly positioned.

memory_items.title: Check Object Availability
memory_items.description: Verify that the object is present before attempting to interact with it.
memory_items.content: Before taking or using an object, check its presence in the current location or accessible receptacles. This avoids unnecessary actions and reduces task failure.

memory_items.title: Avoid Unnecessary Navigation
memory_items.description: Minimize redundant movements to increase efficiency.
memory_items.content: Avoid repetitive navigation between the same locations. Focus on moving directly to relevant locations such as where the object is located or where the task needs to be completed.

memory_items.title: Identify the correct location for the object
memory_items.description: Locate the object (cd) in the correct receptacle (sidetable) before attempting to use the desklamp.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to examine the cd with the desklamp, the agent should first navigate to the sidetable to find the cd. This ensures the cd is accessible and prevents unnecessary steps.

memory_items.title: Use the correct command to interact with the desklamp
memory_items.description: Use the 'use' command with the desklamp to activate it and examine the cd.
memory_items.content: After taking the cd, the agent must use the desklamp instead of repeatedly trying to go to it. The 'use desklamp' command is the correct action to activate the light source for examining the cd.

memory_items.title: Avoid unnecessary navigation loops
memory_items.description: Avoid repeatedly attempting to go to non-existent or unreachable locations.
memory_items.content: The agent should not persistently try to go to a location that does not exist or is not reachable. This can waste steps and lead to failure. Instead, focus on valid locations and actions.

memory_items.title: Check for available actions before proceeding
memory_items.description: Check the valid actions at each step to ensure the next move is feasible.
memory_items.content: Before attempting an action, the agent should check the valid actions to avoid invalid commands. This helps in making informed decisions and progressing efficiently.

memory_items.title: Ensure object is in inventory before using it
memory_items.description: Confirm the object (cd) is in the inventory before attempting to examine it with the desklamp.
memory_items.content: Before using the desklamp to examine the cd, the agent must ensure the cd is in their inventory. This avoids redundant steps and ensures the correct sequence of actions.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Identify and retrieve objects directly from their locations without unnecessary navigation.
memory_items.content: When searching for objects, directly navigate to the receptacle where the object is located and take it, rather than revisiting locations or performing redundant actions.

memory_items.title: Direct Placement Strategy
memory_items.description: Place objects in the target receptacle immediately after retrieval.
memory_items.content: Once an object is retrieved, move it directly to the target receptacle to avoid wasting steps on unnecessary exploration or revisiting locations.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions Before Moving
memory_items.description: Verify valid actions to avoid executing ineffective or invalid commands.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to move an object, check the list of valid actions to ensure the move command is applicable and the target receptacle is accessible.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Navigation
memory_items.description: Minimize back-and-forth movement between locations to improve task efficiency.
memory_items.content: After retrieving an object, avoid unnecessary navigation between locations and proceed directly to the target receptacle for placement.

memory_items.title: Explore Alternative Locations for Second Object
memory_items.description: Search other receptacles systematically for the second object if the first location is exhausted.
memory_items.content: If the first object is placed, systematically explore other receptacles such as dining tables or sidetables to locate the second object efficiently.

memory_items.title: Systematically Search for Objects
memory_items.description: Explore all potential locations where the target object might be found.
memory_items.content: When searching for an object, systematically check all receptacles and surfaces. Open containers and examine their contents to locate the object efficiently.

memory_items.title: Check Inventory Before Placing
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is in inventory before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object to a destination, confirm that it is in the agent's inventory. If not, first locate and take the object from its current location.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions to Navigate
memory_items.description: Avoid repeatedly attempting to navigate to non-existent locations.
memory_items.content: Check the list of valid actions to ensure navigation commands are directed to existing locations. This prevents wasted steps and keeps the task on track.

memory_items.title: Check All Receptacles for the Target Object
memory_items.description: Inspect all containers and surfaces for the object, not just the first few.
memory_items.content: Comprehensively search all cabinets, drawers, and other receptacles, as the target object might be in an unexpected location. Do not limit the search to a few areas.

memory_items.title: Efficiently Use Commands for Object Manipulation
memory_items.description: Use the correct commands to take and move objects.
memory_items.content: Once the object is located, use 'take [object] from [receptacle]' to pick it up and 'move [object] to [receptacle]' to place it in the desired location.

memory_items.title: Search for Potato in Fridge
memory_items.description: The potato must be located in the fridge before it can be cooled.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to cool an object, systematically search all accessible containers, especially the fridge, to locate the target object.

memory_items.title: Cool Object with Fridge
memory_items.description: Cooling an object can be achieved by placing it in the fridge.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, place it inside the fridge for a sufficient duration, ensuring the fridge is open and accessible.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Held Objects
memory_items.description: The agent must keep track of which object it is holding to avoid dropping or misplacing it.
memory_items.content: Regularly check the inventory to confirm the current object being held and ensure it is the correct one for the task.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation without Purpose
memory_items.description: Repeatedly moving between locations without a clear objective leads to inefficiency.
memory_items.content: Plan the navigation path in advance to minimize unnecessary movements and focus on completing the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Place
memory_items.description: Ensure the target object is available and in the correct state before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: Before placing an object, confirm that it is in the correct location and state (e.g., cooled) to avoid task failure.

memory_items.title: Check Fridge Contents Before Heating
memory_items.description: Verify the fridge for the tomato before attempting to heat it.
memory_items.content: Before heating, check the fridge to locate the tomato. If it's not there, search other receptacles or countertops where the tomato might be.

memory_items.title: Use Microwave for Heating
memory_items.description: Heat the tomato using the microwave.
memory_items.content: Once the tomato is found, take it to the microwave, heat it using the microwave, and then place it in the fridge.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation Without Purpose
memory_items.description: Minimize unnecessary movements between locations.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly going back and forth between the same locations without a clear purpose, as it wastes time and may lead to confusion.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions Before Interacting
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct action is available before attempting to interact with an object.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to open or interact with a container, check the list of valid actions to confirm the correct command is available.

memory_items.title: Prioritize Heating Before Placing
memory_items.description: Heat the tomato before placing it in the fridge.
memory_items.content: Ensure the tomato is heated using the appropriate method (e.g., microwave) before attempting to place it in the fridge.

memory_items.title: Systematically Search Storage Areas
memory_items.description: Efficiently search through all possible storage locations to locate the required items.
memory_items.content: Begin by checking common storage areas like drawers, cabinets, and shelves. Open each container and inspect its contents to find the required items. Avoid repetitive and aimless navigation.

memory_items.title: Check Multiple Containers for Required Items
memory_items.description: Ensure that all relevant containers are inspected for the target items.
memory_items.content: Search through multiple containers, including drawers, shelves, and cabinets, as the required items may be located in any of these. Open each container to check its contents.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeating Actions Without Purpose
memory_items.description: Prevent redundant actions that do not contribute to task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly navigating to the same location or performing actions without a clear objective. This saves time and increases the likelihood of finding the required items.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Collected Items
memory_items.description: Maintain an awareness of collected items to ensure the task is completed correctly.
memory_items.content: Check the inventory after collecting each item to ensure that the correct number of items have been gathered. This helps in verifying progress and preventing errors.

memory_items.title: Prioritize Target Locations
memory_items.description: Focus on locations that are more likely to contain the required items.
memory_items.content: Prioritize checking locations that are commonly associated with storing small items like keychains, such as drawers, cabinets, and shelves. This increases the chances of finding the items efficiently.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Identify and retrieve objects from their locations without unnecessary backtracking.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to place objects, systematically search for the required items in likely locations such as countertops, sinks, and cabinets. Once found, directly take the object and proceed to the target location.

memory_items.title: Target Location Access
memory_items.description: Ensure the target receptacle is accessible before attempting to place objects in it.
memory_items.content: Before placing objects in a shelf or other receptacle, navigate directly to the target location. If the receptacle is closed, open it first to ensure access to its contents.

memory_items.title: Inventory Management
memory_items.description: Manage the inventory to carry multiple objects without exceeding capacity.
memory_items.content: After picking up an object, check the inventory to ensure it is the only item carried. If another object is needed, place the current one in the target location before picking up the next one.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Minimize repetitive movements and actions that do not contribute to the task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly checking the same location or performing the same action without purpose. Focus on progressing toward the task goal by moving between locations and interacting with objects efficiently.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability
memory_items.description: Confirm that the object is available in the current location before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to take an object, ensure it is visible and accessible in the current location. If the object is not present, move to the correct location and check again.

memory_items.title: Check for egg in fridge before cooling
memory_items.description: Before attempting to cool an egg, check the fridge to ensure the egg is present.
memory_items.content: Always verify the presence of the target object in the expected location before proceeding with the task. In this case, check the fridge for the egg before attempting to cool it.

memory_items.title: Use the correct cooling method
memory_items.description: Cooling an object typically requires placing it in a refrigerator or freezer.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, place it in a refrigerator or freezer. Ensure that the cooling receptacle is accessible and open before attempting to place the object inside.

memory_items.title: Avoid unnecessary object interactions
memory_items.description: Focus on the relevant objects needed for the task to avoid wasting time on irrelevant items.
memory_items.content: Do not interact with objects that are not essential for completing the task. This helps in reducing the number of steps and prevents confusion.

memory_items.title: Check valid actions for object manipulation
memory_items.description: Before attempting to manipulate an object, check the available actions to ensure the correct command is used.
memory_items.content: Before taking or moving an object, verify the valid actions available to ensure the correct command is executed, such as 'take [object] from [receptacle]'.

memory_items.title: Ensure object is carried before placing it
memory_items.description: An object must be carried before it can be placed in another receptacle.
memory_items.content: Before placing an object in a new location, ensure it is in the agent's inventory. This ensures the object can be moved without additional steps.

memory_items.title: Correct Object Handling
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct object is being manipulated.

memory_items.title: Proper Object Placement
memory_items.description: Place the cooled object in the designated receptacle.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Movements

memory_items.title: Check Object Availability

memory_items.description: Systematically explore different locations to locate the target object.
memory_items.content: When searching for an object, systematically check all possible locations such as furniture, shelves, and tables. Avoid repetitive and inefficient movements by following a structured exploration order.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions for Object Interaction
memory_items.description: Check valid actions to ensure correct object interaction.

memory_items.title: Direct Object Retrieval

memory_items.title: Targeted Movement to Destination

memory_items.title: Avoid Unproductive Loops
memory_items.description: Avoid getting stuck in loops by focusing on relevant locations.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly attempting to move to non-existent or irrelevant locations. Focus on locations that are likely to contain the target object or are necessary for task completion.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Take
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is present and accessible before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to take an object, confirm its presence in the current location or accessible receptacle. Repeatedly attempting to take an object that is not present or not properly located can waste steps and lead to failure.

memory_items.title: Use the Correct Syntax for Interacting with Objects
memory_items.description: Use the correct command syntax when interacting with objects to avoid errors.
memory_items.content: Always use the correct command format when taking, moving, or cooling objects. For example, 'take pan 1 from diningtable 1' is the correct syntax to pick up an object from a surface.

memory_items.title: Cool Object with a Valid Receptacle
memory_items.description: Use a valid receptacle that can cool an object to complete the task.
memory_items.content: When cooling an object, use a receptacle that has the capability to cool, such as a fridge. Ensure that the fridge is open and accessible before attempting to cool the object.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Location After Cooling
memory_items.description: After cooling the object, move it to the target location as required by the task.
memory_items.content: Once the object has been cooled, move it to the designated location using the 'move' command. Ensure that the target location is accessible and the object is being carried.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated and Unnecessary Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repeating actions that do not contribute to the task completion.
memory_items.content: Avoid unnecessary actions such as repeatedly checking valid actions or moving between locations without purpose. Focus on the essential steps required to complete the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Directly Navigate to Target Location
memory_items.description: Navigate directly to the target location to efficiently locate and interact with objects.
memory_items.content: Before searching for objects, go directly to the target location (e.g., desk) to quickly assess its contents and plan next steps.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions for Object Interaction
memory_items.description: Use the check valid actions command to identify available interactions with objects and receptacles.
memory_items.content: Checking valid actions provides a list of possible interactions, helping to determine the correct command for picking up or moving objects.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Retrieval from Shelves
memory_items.description: Retrieve objects directly from shelves or other receptacles without unnecessary steps.
memory_items.content: If the target object is on a shelf or similar receptacle, go directly there, pick up the object, and proceed to the destination location.

memory_items.title: Minimize Unnecessary Movements
memory_items.description: Avoid redundant movements to save time and effort in completing the task.
memory_items.content: Once the object is retrieved, move directly to the target location and place the object there without unnecessary detours.

memory_items.title: Use Move Command for Object Placement
memory_items.description: Use the move command to place an object in the desired location after picking it up.
memory_items.content: After picking up an object, use the move command to place it in the target location, ensuring it is correctly positioned as required by the task.

memory_items.title: Understand Task Requirements
memory_items.description: Clarify the task goal to ensure the correct action sequence is followed.
memory_items.content: Before starting, ensure you fully understand what needs to be done. For example, in this case, 'look at pen under the desklamp' requires examining the pen while it is under the desklamp, not just finding the pen and examining it elsewhere.

memory_items.title: Check Object Interaction Validity
memory_items.description: Verify if the object can be interacted with as intended.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to use or examine an object, check if it is valid to do so. For example, the desklamp might not be a light source or might not be functional for examining objects.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Do not repeat actions that have already been tried and failed.
memory_items.content: If an action does not produce the desired result, avoid repeating it unnecessarily. This helps in efficiently exploring other possible solutions.

memory_items.title: Use Appropriate Commands for Observation
memory_items.description: Use the correct commands to observe and interact with objects in the environment.
memory_items.content: Use 'look' or 'examine' commands to inspect objects and their surroundings. Ensure that these commands are used in the right context and location.

memory_items.title: Understand Light Source Interaction
memory_items.description: Recognize that certain objects may require specific interactions to be examined under light.
memory_items.content: Some objects might need to be placed under a light source or interacted with in a specific way to be examined properly. Understand that the desklamp might not be a light source or might require additional steps.

memory_items.title: Open Containers Before Accessing Contents

memory_items.title: Take Objects from the Same Location Sequentially

memory_items.title: Navigate Efficiently Between Locations

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions for Available Locations

memory_items.content: Use the 'check valid actions' command to determine which locations are accessible and prioritize those relevant to the task.

memory_items.title: Locate Object Before Picking It Up
memory_items.description: Finding the object in its current location is essential before attempting to pick it up.
memory_items.content: Survey the environment to locate the object, then move to its location and pick it up using the 'take' command.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Receptacle

memory_items.title: Avoid Unnecessary Exploration
memory_items.description: Exploring irrelevant areas can lead to inefficiency and prolong task completion.
memory_items.content: Focus on locations directly related to the task goal to avoid unnecessary exploration and conserve time.

memory_items.title: Cool Object Using Fridge
memory_items.description: Cool an object by using the fridge as a cooling source.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, use the 'cool [object] with fridge 1' command once the object is in hand and the fridge is open.

memory_items.title: Locate and Pick Lettuce
memory_items.description: Find the lettuce on the dining table before cooling it.
memory_items.content: Check the dining table directly for the lettuce, as it is often already present there.

memory_items.title: Navigate Efficiently Between Locations
memory_items.description: Move between locations efficiently to minimize steps.
memory_items.content: Use direct navigation commands to move between locations, avoiding unnecessary back-and-forth movements.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is available before attempting to cool or move it.
memory_items.content: Check the availability of the lettuce on the dining table before attempting to pick it up.

memory_items.title: Use the Correct Command Syntax
memory_items.description: Use the correct command syntax for cooling and moving objects.
memory_items.content: Use 'cool [object] with [receptacle]' for cooling and 'move [object] to [receptacle]' for placing the cooled object.

memory_items.title: Heat Object Correctly
memory_items.description: Heat an object using the correct method and container.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to heat an object, ensure it is placed inside the heating appliance (like a microwave) and that the appliance is operational. Use the 'heat' command with the correct container.

memory_items.title: Verify Object State
memory_items.description: Check if the object is hot before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: After heating, verify the object's state to ensure it is hot. If the object is not hot, reheat it or check if the heating method was applied correctly.

memory_items.title: Use Appropriate Placement
memory_items.description: Place the object in the correct receptacle after completing the task.
memory_items.content: After heating, move the object to the designated receptacle using the 'move' command. Ensure the object is in your inventory before attempting to place it.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid unnecessary movements and repeated checks.
memory_items.content: Minimize redundant actions such as repeatedly going to the same location or checking the same object. Focus on the essential steps required to complete the task.

memory_items.title: Check Inventory Before Placing
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is in inventory before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object to a receptacle, confirm it is in your inventory. If it is not, retrieve it from its current location.

memory_items.title: Cool Object Using Fridge
memory_items.description: Cool an object by using the fridge as a cooling source.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, use the 'cool [object] with fridge 1' command after picking up the object. Ensure the fridge is open before attempting to cool the object.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Microwave
memory_items.description: Place a cooled object into the microwave.
memory_items.content: After cooling the object, navigate to the microwave, open it if necessary, and use the 'move [object] to microwave 1' command to place the cooled object inside.

memory_items.title: Check Microwave Contents Before Placing
memory_items.description: Verify the contents of the microwave before placing an object inside.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object into the microwave, check if it is open and observe its contents to avoid placing objects in an occupied space.

memory_items.title: Efficient Navigation and Object Handling
memory_items.description: Navigate directly to the required locations and handle objects efficiently.
memory_items.content: Move directly to the location of the object, pick it up, and proceed to the next required location without unnecessary detours or actions.

memory_items.title: Handle Unexpected Objects in Microwave
memory_items.description: Address unexpected objects in the microwave before placing the desired object.
memory_items.content: If an unexpected object is found in the microwave, move it to another location first to ensure the microwave is clear before placing the cooled object.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Location Directly
memory_items.description: Once an object is taken, move it directly to the target location.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Carried Objects

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation to the Same Location

memory_items.title: Take Multiple Objects from the Same Source

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Navigation

memory_items.content: Before examining or interacting with the contents of a container, ensure it is open. This avoids overlooking objects that are inside closed receptacles.

memory_items.title: Move Objects to Target Location Efficiently
memory_items.description: Once an object is obtained, directly move it to the target location to minimize steps and avoid confusion.
memory_items.content: After picking up an object, immediately move it to the intended destination to streamline the process and reduce the chance of errors.

memory_items.title: Explore All Potential Locations for Target Objects
memory_items.description: Systematically check all relevant locations to locate the required objects, including sinks, countertops, and cabinets.
memory_items.content: Search all potential locations where the target objects might be found, such as countertops, sinks, and cabinets, to ensure no object is overlooked.

memory_items.title: Direct Object Interaction
memory_items.description: Identify and interact with the target object directly when it is visible.
memory_items.content: When the target object is visible in the current location, attempt to take it directly. This avoids unnecessary navigation and ensures immediate access to the object.

memory_items.title: Cleaning with Appropriate Receptacle
memory_items.description: Use a suitable receptacle to clean the object before placing it.
memory_items.content: After picking up the object, navigate to a cleaning receptacle (like a sinkbasin) and perform the cleaning action to ensure the object is clean before placing it.

memory_items.title: Efficient Navigation
memory_items.description: Navigate directly to the required locations without unnecessary back-and-forth.
memory_items.content: Move directly to the object's location, then to the cleaning receptacle, and finally to the target placement location to minimize steps and improve efficiency.

memory_items.title: Verify Object State
memory_items.description: Check the object's state to ensure it is in the correct condition before proceeding.
memory_items.content: Examine the object to confirm its current state, especially if there is uncertainty about its cleanliness or availability, to avoid redundant actions.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Location
memory_items.description: Move the cleaned object to the designated target location.
memory_items.content: After cleaning the object, navigate back to the target location and move the object there to complete the task.

memory_items.title: Locate and Retrieve the Object

memory_items.title: Navigate to Target Receptacle

memory_items.title: Cool Tomato Using Sink
memory_items.description: Cool the tomato by placing it in the sink and running water over it.
memory_items.content: Once the tomato is found, take it to the sink, place it in the sink, and run water over it to cool it down. This is the most effective way to cool the tomato in the environment.

memory_items.title: Use Microwave for Storage

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Identify and retrieve objects directly from their visible locations without unnecessary navigation.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to move an object, ensure you are at the correct location where the object is visible. This reduces the number of steps and avoids confusion.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability
memory_items.description: Check if an object is actually present in the expected location before attempting to take or move it.
memory_items.content: Always confirm the presence of an object in a receptacle or location before attempting to take or move it, as the environment may have changed or the object may not be there.

memory_items.title: Use Move Command Properly
memory_items.description: Use the move command to transfer objects between locations, ensuring the destination is accessible and correct.
memory_items.content: After picking up an object, navigate to the target location and use the move command to place the object there. Confirm that the destination is accessible and the object is successfully moved.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions
memory_items.description: Regularly check valid actions to ensure you are using the correct commands for the current situation.
memory_items.content: Frequently check the list of valid actions to avoid using incorrect commands that may lead to errors or wasted steps.

memory_items.title: Handle Multiple Objects
memory_items.description: Manage carrying one object at a time and plan for retrieving additional objects from different locations.
memory_items.content: Since the agent can only carry one object at a time, plan to retrieve and move objects sequentially, ensuring each object is handled properly before moving on to the next.

memory_items.title: Identify and locate the target object
memory_items.description: The agent must first locate the pot in the environment before proceeding with cooling and placement.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to cool and place the pot, the agent should systematically search all possible locations (e.g., countertops, cabinets, fridge) to find the pot. This involves navigating to each location, opening containers if necessary, and examining contents.

memory_items.title: Cool the object using a suitable method
memory_items.description: The agent needs to use the correct method to cool the object, which may involve placing it in a refrigerator or using a cooling appliance.
memory_items.content: Once the pot is located, the agent should place it in a refrigerator or use a cooling method to achieve the desired cooling effect. This requires identifying a cooling receptacle and using the appropriate command to apply the cooling process.

memory_items.title: Place the object in the designated location
memory_items.description: After cooling, the agent must place the object in the specified location, such as a countertop.
memory_items.content: After successfully cooling the pot, the agent should navigate to the designated location (e.g., countertop) and use the appropriate command to place the cooled pot there.

memory_items.title: Avoid redundant navigation and object examination
memory_items.description: Redundant movements and repeated object checks can lead to inefficiency and failure to complete the task.
memory_items.content: The agent should avoid unnecessary navigation between locations and repeated examination of objects unless new information is obtained. This helps in maintaining focus and efficiency in task execution.

memory_items.title: Ensure proper object handling and container access
memory_items.description: The agent must correctly handle objects and access containers to retrieve and manipulate items effectively.
memory_items.content: When retrieving objects from containers, the agent must ensure the container is open and the object is accessible. Proper handling of objects and containers is essential to avoid errors during task execution.

memory_items.title: Check Object Availability Before Heating
memory_items.description: Ensure the object to be heated is available in the environment before attempting to heat it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to heat an object, verify its presence in the current location or accessible receptacles. This prevents unnecessary actions and ensures the task can proceed efficiently.

memory_items.title: Use the Correct Heating Method
memory_items.description: Identify and use the appropriate heating method for the object.
memory_items.content: Heating an object typically requires using a stoveburner or microwave. Ensure the correct method is applied based on the object and the environment.

memory_items.title: Check for Object Placement in Target Receptacle
memory_items.description: Verify that the target receptacle is accessible and suitable for placing the heated object.
memory_items.content: Before placing the object in the coffeemachine, confirm that the receptacle is open and accessible. This avoids failed attempts due to incorrect placement.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation Without Purpose
memory_items.description: Minimize unnecessary navigation between locations to save time and resources.
memory_items.content: Focus on purposeful navigation to relevant locations (e.g., where the object is located or where heating is needed) to avoid wasting steps.

memory_items.title: Verify Object State After Heating
memory_items.description: Confirm the object is hot after heating before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: After heating the object, check its state to ensure it is hot before proceeding to place it in the coffeemachine. This prevents placing a cold object and ensures task success.

memory_items.title: Identify Light Source Location
memory_items.description: Locate the light source (desklamp) before attempting to examine an object under it.
memory_items.content: Before trying to look at an object under a light source, the agent should first navigate to the light source's location to confirm its presence and ensure it is functional.

memory_items.title: Check Object Location Before Taking
memory_items.description: Verify the object's location before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before taking an object, the agent should check its current location and ensure it is accessible. If the object is not in the current location, the agent should navigate to the correct location.

memory_items.title: Use Light Source Correctly
memory_items.description: Use the light source properly to illuminate the object.
memory_items.content: Once the object is located and the light source is identified, the agent should use the light source to illuminate the object, which may involve interacting with the light source before examining the object.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repetitive and unnecessary actions that do not contribute to the task.
memory_items.content: The agent should avoid repeatedly attempting to interact with objects or locations without a clear purpose, as this can waste time and lead to failure.

memory_items.title: Examine Object Directly
memory_items.description: Examine the object directly without unnecessary movement.
memory_items.content: After locating the object, the agent should examine it directly rather than moving it to another location, as the task requires examining the object under the light source, not moving it.

memory_items.title: Locate and Retrieve the Ladle
memory_items.description: Identify the location of the ladle before attempting to clean it.
memory_items.content: Search countertops and other surfaces systematically to locate the ladle. Once found, take it to perform the cleaning action.

memory_items.title: Clean the Ladle Using a Sink
memory_items.description: Use a sink to clean the ladle effectively.
memory_items.content: After retrieving the ladle, navigate to a sink and use it to clean the ladle. This ensures proper hygiene and prepares the ladle for placement.

memory_items.title: Open the Target Drawer Before Placement
memory_items.description: Ensure the drawer is open before placing the cleaned ladle inside.

memory_items.title: Search for Objects in Common Locations
memory_items.description: Look for objects in likely locations such as beds, drawers, and tables rather than repeatedly attempting to access non-existent objects.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to find objects, check common locations like beds, drawers, and tables. These are typical places where objects such as cellphones might be stored.

memory_items.title: Efficient Use of Inventory and Movement
memory_items.description: Avoid unnecessary movements and focus on efficiently using inventory commands to place objects.
memory_items.content: Once an object is found, use the 'move' command to place it directly into the target receptacle. Avoid redundant navigation and focus on completing the task with minimal steps.

memory_items.title: Check for Objects in Multiple Receptacles
memory_items.description: Systematically check multiple receptacles to locate the required objects.
memory_items.content: If one receptacle does not contain the object, systematically check other receptacles such as drawers, shelves, and sidetables to locate the required items.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeating Actions on Non-Responsive Objects
memory_items.description: Do not repeatedly attempt to interact with objects or locations that do not respond to commands.
memory_items.content: If a command such as 'go to desk 1' yields no result, move on to other potential locations. Repeating the same action is inefficient and may waste time.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions to Confirm Object Locations
memory_items.description: Use the 'check valid actions' command to identify available locations and objects to interact with.
memory_items.content: Before navigating, use 'check valid actions' to determine the correct locations to go to and objects to interact with, which can help in efficiently finding and placing objects.

memory_items.content: Once the object is cleaned, move it to the designated drawer using the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command, ensuring the drawer is accessible and not already closed.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Search
memory_items.description: Systematically search locations where objects are commonly found.
memory_items.content: Explore key locations like shelves, tables, and furniture to locate objects efficiently, as these are typical places where objects are stored or placed.

memory_items.title: Object Pickup and Placement
memory_items.description: Pick up objects and place them in the target location.
memory_items.content: Once an object is found, take it and move it to the designated location. Ensure the target location is accessible and the object is carried properly.

memory_items.title: Repeated Attempts for Multiple Objects
memory_items.description: Attempt to collect multiple objects from the same location.
memory_items.content: If multiple objects are present in a location, repeatedly attempt to take them to ensure all required objects are collected.

memory_items.title: Inventory Management
memory_items.description: Check inventory to confirm carried objects.
memory_items.content: Use the inventory command to verify which objects are currently being carried, ensuring that you do not miss any objects during the task.

memory_items.title: Avoiding Redundant Navigation
memory_items.description: Minimize unnecessary movements between locations.
memory_items.content: Avoid repeatedly moving between the same locations, as it wastes time and may lead to confusion or errors in task completion.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Move
memory_items.description: Ensure the object you want to move is present in the current location before attempting to move it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to move an object, check if it is in the current location. If it is not, navigate to the correct location where the object is located.

memory_items.title: Correctly Identify the Target Object
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct object is being moved to the target location.
memory_items.content: Confirm the object you are carrying matches the object you intend to place. If the object is incorrect, discard it and find the correct one.

memory_items.title: Open Target Container Before Placing Object
memory_items.description: Ensure the target container is open before placing an object inside it.
memory_items.content: Before placing an object in a drawer or cabinet, check if it is open. If it is closed, open it first before attempting to place the object inside.

memory_items.title: Use the Correct Command for Object Placement
memory_items.description: Use the proper command to move an object to a receptacle.
memory_items.content: Use the command 'move [object] to [receptacle]' to place an object in a receptacle. Avoid using incorrect or ambiguous commands that may lead to failure.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid unnecessary movements or repeated actions that do not contribute to completing the task.
memory_items.content: Minimize redundant navigation and repeated attempts to move the same object. Focus on the essential steps required to complete the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Heat Object with Correct Appliance
memory_items.description: Heat the object using the appropriate appliance for the task.
memory_items.content: To heat an object, use the correct appliance such as a microwave or stoveburner. Ensure the appliance is open and the object is placed inside before heating.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Placement Before Heating
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is in the correct location before attempting to heat it.
memory_items.content: Before heating an object, confirm it is in the correct receptacle or on the correct surface. If the object is not in the right place, move it there first.

memory_items.title: Place Hot Object in Target Receptacle
memory_items.description: After heating, place the hot object in the target receptacle.
memory_items.content: Once the object is heated, move it to the target receptacle. Ensure the object is carried correctly and placed in the correct location.

memory_items.title: Avoid Confusing Objects
memory_items.description: Avoid picking up the wrong object or confusing similar objects.
memory_items.content: Carefully identify the correct object for the task to avoid confusion. Verify the object's identity and ensure it is the one intended for heating and placement.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory to Track Carried Objects
memory_items.description: Use inventory commands to track what is being carried.
memory_items.content: Regularly check the inventory to ensure the correct object is being carried. This helps in avoiding mistakes when moving or heating the object.

memory_items.title: Search for Remote Controls in Likely Locations
memory_items.description: Remote controls are often found on or inside furniture like dressers, drawers, or tables.
memory_items.content: Begin by checking common locations such as dressers, drawers, and tables. Use the 'examine' command to inspect surfaces and open containers to search for remote controls.

memory_items.title: Prioritize Taking Remote Controls Before Moving
memory_items.description: Ensure remote controls are taken before attempting to move them to the ottoman.
memory_items.content: Once a remote control is located, use the 'take' command to pick it up before attempting to move it. This avoids unnecessary navigation and ensures the object is in inventory.

memory_items.title: Check Multiple Locations for Second Remote Control
memory_items.description: Remote controls may be found in multiple locations, so systematically check all potential storage areas.
memory_items.content: After retrieving one remote control, continue searching other locations such as additional drawers, cabinets, or other furniture to locate the second remote control.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory Management to Track Objects
memory_items.description: Keep track of objects in inventory to ensure both remote controls are collected before placing them.
memory_items.content: Regularly check the inventory to confirm both remote controls are in possession before attempting to place them in the ottoman.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation to Unproductive Locations
memory_items.description: Repeatedly attempting to navigate to non-existent or unproductive locations wastes time and resources.
memory_items.content: Focus on valid locations that are likely to contain the required objects. Avoid redundant actions that do not contribute to the task completion.

memory_items.title: Efficient Navigation to Object Locations
memory_items.description: Directly navigate to potential object locations to minimize steps.
memory_items.content: When searching for an object, move directly to likely locations such as sidetables, drawers, or other storage areas. This reduces the number of steps needed to locate and retrieve the object.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions to Confirm Object Presence
memory_items.description: Check valid actions to confirm the presence of objects and their locations.
memory_items.content: Before moving to a new location, check valid actions to identify objects and their locations. This helps avoid unnecessary movements and ensures efficient task execution.

memory_items.title: Handle Container Access When Necessary
memory_items.description: Open containers to access objects stored inside them.
memory_items.content: If an object is inside a closed container, open the container first before attempting to take the object. This is crucial for accessing objects in drawers or cabinets.

memory_items.title: Direct Object Placement Strategy
memory_items.description: Once the object is obtained, navigate directly to the target location for placement.
memory_items.content: After retrieving the object, move directly to the target receptacle (e.g., sofa) to place the object. This minimizes steps and ensures the task is completed efficiently.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Take
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is available and accessible before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before taking an object, confirm its presence and accessibility in the current location. This prevents wasted steps and ensures the task proceeds smoothly.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Availability Before Attempting to Take
memory_items.description: Check if the object is present in the receptacle before attempting to take it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to take an object, confirm its presence in the current location. If the object is not visible, explore other receptacles or check the inventory.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Actions on the Same Object
memory_items.description: Repeating the same action on an object without success can lead to inefficiency.
memory_items.content: If an action (like taking an object) does not work, consider alternative approaches or locations. Avoid repeatedly performing the same action without a clear strategy.

memory_items.title: Use Inventory Management to Track Carried Objects
memory_items.description: Keep track of which objects are being carried to avoid confusion.
memory_items.content: Regularly check the inventory to ensure you are aware of which objects you are carrying. This helps prevent errors like attempting to move an object that is not in possession.

memory_items.title: Explore Multiple Locations for Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Objects may be located in various receptacles, so systematically explore different locations.
memory_items.content: If an object is not found in the initial location, systematically explore other receptacles such as drawers, sidetables, or other furniture. This increases the chances of locating the required objects.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions to Move Objects to Target Locations
memory_items.description: Ensure the correct action is used to move objects to the target location.
memory_items.content: When placing an object in a receptacle, use the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command. Verify the receptacle is accessible and the object is in inventory before attempting to move it.

memory_items.title: Heat Object with Appropriate Heater
memory_items.description: Use a microwave or stoveburner to heat an object based on the available heating methods.
memory_items.content: Identify the correct heating appliance (microwave or stoveburner) and use the 'heat' command with the object and the appliance to successfully heat it.

memory_items.title: Move Object to Target Location
memory_items.description: Transfer an object to a designated receptacle after completing the required action.
memory_items.content: Once the object is heated, move it to the target receptacle using the 'move' command to complete the task.

memory_items.title: Check Inventory Before Heating
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is in hand before attempting to heat it.
memory_items.content: Verify the object is in the inventory before using the 'heat' command to avoid failed attempts.

memory_items.title: Open Containing Receptacle
memory_items.description: Access the contents of a closed receptacle by opening it first.
memory_items.content: Before interacting with the contents of a closed container, open it to access the objects inside.

memory_items.title: Use Efficient Path to Target
memory_items.description: Navigate directly to the target location to minimize unnecessary steps.
memory_items.content: Choose the most direct path to the target location to save time and avoid confusion during task execution.

memory_items.title: Cool Object Using Container
memory_items.description: Cool an object by using a container as a cooling source.
memory_items.content: To cool an object, use the 'cool [object] with [receptacle]' command with a container like a fridge. Ensure the container is open and accessible before attempting to cool the object.

memory_items.title: Place Object in Target Receptacle
memory_items.description: Move an object to the designated target location.
memory_items.content: After completing the required processing step (e.g., cooling), use the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command to place the object in the target receptacle, such as a dining table.

memory_items.title: Check Inventory Before Action
memory_items.description: Verify the current inventory state before attempting an action.
memory_items.content: Before executing actions like cooling or moving an object, check the inventory to ensure the object is being carried. If not, retrieve it from the appropriate location.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions Efficiently
memory_items.description: Avoid redundant actions and focus on valid commands that contribute to task completion.
memory_items.content: Use the 'check valid actions' command to identify actionable steps and avoid unnecessary movements or repeated attempts on ineffective commands.

memory_items.title: Handle Object Retrieval from Container
memory_items.description: Retrieve an object from a container after it has been placed inside.
memory_items.content: If an object was moved into a container and needs to be retrieved, use the 'take [object] from [receptacle]' command to pick it up again.

memory_items.title: Consistency in Task Execution

memory_items.content: All successful trajectories followed the same sequence: go to the object's location, take the object, go to the target receptacle, and place the object. This consistency ensures reliability.

memory_items.title: Avoiding Unnecessary Actions
memory_items.description: Minimize steps by avoiding redundant actions.
memory_items.content: Successful strategies avoided extra steps such as opening containers or examining objects, focusing only on necessary actions to complete the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions Before Moving

memory_items.title: Directly Interact with Objects

memory_items.title: Use Efficient Navigation

memory_items.title: Verify Object Presence Before Attempting to Take

memory_items.content: Before taking an object, confirm its presence in the current location to avoid failed attempts and wasted steps.

memory_items.content: Once the light source is activated and the object is in view, directly interact with the object by examining or taking it to fulfill the task efficiently.

memory_items.title: Efficient Navigation
memory_items.description: Navigate directly to the relevant location.
memory_items.content: Go directly to the location where the object and light source are located to minimize steps and ensure quick access to the required items.

memory_items.title: Avoid Redundant Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid unnecessary steps that do not contribute to the task.
memory_items.content: Skip actions that do not provide new information or progress toward the task, such as repeated 'look' commands when the object is already in view.

memory_items.title: Prioritize Object Retrieval
memory_items.description: Retrieve the object once the conditions are met.
memory_items.content: Once the light source is activated and the object is visible, take the object directly to complete the task without additional delays.

memory_items.title: Verify Object Placement
memory_items.description: Ensure the object is placed on the target receptacle by confirming the action's success.
memory_items.content: After attempting to move an object to a receptacle, check if the action was successful by observing the environment or using the 'inventory' command to confirm the object's location.

memory_items.title: Use Correct Placement Command
memory_items.description: Use the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command to place an object on a receptacle.
memory_items.content: To place an object on a receptacle, use the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command after picking up the object, ensuring both the object and the receptacle are in the same location.

memory_items.title: Check Valid Actions Before Attempting Placement
memory_items.description: Verify available actions to ensure the placement command is valid.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to place an object, check the valid actions to confirm that the 'move [object] to [receptacle]' command is available and applicable.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Invalid Actions
memory_items.description: Avoid repeatedly attempting the same invalid action without checking for changes in the environment.
memory_items.content: If an action fails, investigate the environment for changes or consult valid actions before retrying to avoid wasting steps on ineffective actions.

memory_items.title: Ensure Object is in Inventory
memory_items.description: Confirm the object is in the inventory before attempting to place it.
memory_items.content: Before attempting to place an object on a receptacle, use the 'inventory' command to ensure the object is in the inventory and ready to be moved.

memory_items.title: Efficient Object Search
memory_items.description: Systematically search all possible locations for objects instead of repeatedly trying to navigate to non-existent locations.
memory_items.content: When searching for objects, explore all visible receptacles and surfaces. Avoid repeatedly attempting to navigate to non-existent locations like 'desk 1' if they are not present in the environment.

memory_items.title: Use Valid Actions to Move Objects
memory_items.description: Only attempt to move objects using valid actions that are supported by the environment.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object, ensure that the action is valid. Check the list of valid actions to confirm that moving the object to the target receptacle is possible.

memory_items.title: Check Multiple Locations for Target Objects
memory_items.description: Search multiple locations to find all required objects, not just the first one encountered.
memory_items.content: After finding one object, continue searching other locations such as tables, drawers, or sidetables to locate the second object. Avoid stopping the search prematurely.

memory_items.title: Open Containers Before Accessing Contents
memory_items.description: Ensure containers are open before attempting to access or move objects inside them.
memory_items.content: Before moving an object into a drawer or other container, check if it is open. If it is closed, open it first to access its contents.

memory_items.title: Avoid Repeated Navigation to Non-Existent Locations
memory_items.description: Do not waste time navigating to locations that are not present in the environment.
memory_items.content: If attempting to navigate to a location results in 'Nothing happens,' it is likely that the location does not exist. Focus instead on valid and existing locations.
